member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.TilesY
member.summary: The vertical dimension of the imagery in number of tiles.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.TilesX
member.summary: The horizontal dimension of the imagery in number of tiles.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.Orientation
member.summary: The orientation of the viewport for the imagery metadata in degrees where 0 = North [default], 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.ZoomMin
member.summary: The minimum zoom level available for this imagery set.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.ZoomMax
member.summary: The maximum zoom level available for this imagery set.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.VintageEnd
member.summary: The latest date found in an imagery set or for a specific imagery tile.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.VintageStart
member.summary: The earliest date found in an imagery set or for a specific imagery tile.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.ImageUrlSubdomains
member.summary: One or more URL subdomains that may be used when constructing an image tile URL.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.ImageUrl
member.summary: Either a URL template for an image tile if a specific point is specified, or a general URL template for the specified imagery set.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.ImageWidth
member.summary: The width of the image tile.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ImageryMetadataResource.ImageHeight
member.summary: The height of the image tile.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.ProviderInfo
member.summary: The contact information for the provider of the transit information.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.PhoneNumber
member.summary: The phone number of the transit agency.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.Uri
member.summary: The URI for the transit agency.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.LineTextColor
member.summary: The color to use for text associated with the transit line. The color is provided as an RGB value.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.LineColor
member.summary: The color associated with the transit line. The color is provided as an RGB value.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.AgencyName
member.summary: The name of the transit agency.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.AgencyId
member.summary: The ID associated with the transit agency.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.AbbreviatedName
member.summary: The abbreviated name of the transit line, such as the bus number.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TransitLine.VerboseName
member.summary: The full name of the transit line.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.RoutePath
member.summary: A representation of the path of a route. A RoutePath is returned only if the routePathOutput parameter is set to Points. A RoutePath is defined by a Line element that contains of a collection of points. The path of the route is the line that connects these Points. For more information about the fields contained in a route Path, see the Route Path Fields section below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.RouteLegs
member.summary: Information about a section of a route between two waypoints. For more information about the fields contained ina routeLeg, see the Route Leg Fields section below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.TravelDuration
member.summary: The time in seconds that it takes to travel a corresponding TravelDistance.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.TravelDistance
member.summary: The physical distance covered by the entire route. Note: This value is not supported for the Transit travel mode.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.DurationUnit
member.summary: The unit used for time of travel.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.DistanceUnit
member.summary: The unit used for distance.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.Bbox
member.summary: Defines a rectangular area by using latitude and longitude boundaries that contain the corresponding route or location. A bounding box contains SouthLatitude, WestLongitude, NorthLatitude, and EastLongitude elements.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteResource.Id
member.summary: A unique ID for the resource.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RoutePath.Point
member.summary: The coordinates of a point on the Earth.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RoutePath.Line
member.summary: When the points in the line are connected, they represent the path of the route.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.ItineraryItems
member.summary: Information that defines a step in the route. For information about the fields that make up the ItineraryItem collection, see the Itinerary Item Fields table below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.EndLocation
member.summary: Information about the location of the ending waypoint for a route. An EndLocation is provided only when the waypoint is specified as a landmark or an address. For more information about the fields contained in a Location collection, see the Locations Fields table below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.StartLocation
member.summary: Information about the location of the starting waypoint for a route. A StartLocation is provided only when the waypoint is specified as a landmark or an address. For more information about the fields contained in a Location collection, see the Location Fields table below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.ActualEnd
member.summary: The Point (latitude and longitude) that was used as the actual ending location for the route leg. In most cases, the ActualEnd is the same as the requested waypoint. However, if a waypoint is not close to a road, the Routes API chooses a location on the nearest road as the ending point of the route. This ActualEnd element contains the latitude and longitude of this new location.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.ActualStart
member.summary: The Point (latitude and longitude) that was used as the actual starting location for the route leg. In most cases, the ActualStart is the same as the requested waypoint. However, if a waypoint is not close to a road, the Routes API chooses a location on the nearest road as the starting point of the route. This ActualStart element contains the latitude and longitude of this new location.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.TravelDuration
member.summary: The time, in seconds, that it takes to travel a corresponding TravelDistance.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RouteLeg.TravelDistance
member.summary: The physical distance covered by a route leg.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Warnings
member.summary: Information about a condition that may affect a specific step in the route. Warning is an optional element and a route step can contain more than one warning.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TravelMode
member.summary: The mode of travel for a specific step in the route. Note: This value is not supported for ItineraryItems that are part of a ChildItineraryItems collection.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TravelDuration
member.summary: The time in seconds that it takes to travel a corresponding TravelDistance.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TravelDistance
member.summary: The physical distance covered by this route step. Note: This value is not supported for the Transit travel mode.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TransitTerminus
member.summary: The end destination for the transit line in the direction you are traveling.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TransitStopId
member.summary: The ID assigned to the transit stop by the transit agency.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TransitLine
member.summary: Information about the transit line associated with the itinerary item. For more information about the fields contained in the TransitLine collection, see the Transit Line Fields table below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TowardsRoadName
member.summary: The name of the street that the route goes towards in the first itinerary item.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.TollZone
member.summary: The name or number of the toll zone.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Time
member.summary: The arrival or departure time for the transit step.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Signs
member.summary: Signage text for the route. There may be more than one sign value for an itinerary item.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.SideOfStreet
member.summary: The side of the street where the destination is found based on the arrival direction. This field applies to the last itinerary item only.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.ManeuverPoint
member.summary: The coordinates of a point on the Earth where a maneuver is required, such as a left turn. A ManeuverPoint contains Latitude and Longitude elements. Note: This value is not supported for ItineraryItems that are part of a ChildItineraryItems collection.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Instruction
member.summary: A description of a maneuver in a set of directions. In addition to the content of the instruction field, this field has an attribute maneuverType that is set to the type of maneuver, such as 'TurnLeft.'

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.IconType
member.summary: The type of icon to display.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Hints
member.summary: Additional information that may be helpful in following a route. In addition to the hint text, this element has an attribute hintType that specifies what the hint refers to, such as “NextIntersection.” Hint is an optional element and a route step can contain more than one hint.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Exit
member.summary: The name or number of the exit associated with this itinerary step.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.Details
member.summary: Information about one of the maneuvers that is part of the itinerary item. An ItineraryItem can contain more than one Detail collection. For information about the fields contained in a Detail collection, see the Detail Fields table below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.CompassDirection
member.summary: The direction of travel associated with a maneuver on a route, such as south or southwest. Note: This value is not supported for the Transit travel mode.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryItem.ChildItineraryItems
member.summary: A collection of ItineraryItems that divides an itinerary item into smaller steps. An itinerary item can have only one set of ChildItineraryItems.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryDetail.RoadType
member.summary: The type of road.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryDetail.EndPathIndices
member.summary: StartPathIndices and EndPathIndices specify index values for specific route path points that are returned in the response when the routePathOutput parameter is set to Points. Together, these two index values define a range of route path points that correspond to a maneuver. Route path index values are integers where the first route path point has an index value of 0.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryDetail.StartPathIndices
member.summary: StartPathIndices and EndPathIndices specify index values for specific route path points that are returned in the response when the routePathOutput parameter is set to Points. Together, these two index values define a range of route path points that correspond to a maneuver. Route path index values are integers where the first route path point has an index value of 0.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryDetail.Names
member.summary: A street, highway or intersection where the maneuver occurs. If the maneuver is complex, there may be more than one name field in the details collection. The name field may also have no value. This can occur if the name is not known or if a street, highway or intersection does not have a name. Note: This value is only supported for the transit travel mode.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryDetail.ManeuverType
member.summary: The type of maneuver described by this detail collection. The ManeuverType in A detail collection can provide information for a portion of the maneuver described by the maneuverType attribute of the corresponding Instruction. For example the maneuverType attribute of an Instruction may specify TurnLeftThenTurnRight as the maneuver while the associated detail items may specify specifics about the TurnLeft and TurnRight maneuvers.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ItineraryDetail.CompassDegrees
member.summary: The direction in degrees. Note: This value is not supported for the Transit travel mode.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.ErrorDetails
member.summary: A collection of error descriptions. For example, ErrorDetails can identify parameter values that are not valid or missing.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.ResourceSets
member.summary: A collection of ResourceSet objects. A ResourceSet is a container of Resources returned by the request. For more information, see the ResourceSet section below.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.BrandLogoUri
member.summary: A URL that references a brand image to support contractual branding requirements.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.Copyright
member.summary: A copyright notice.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.TraceId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the request.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.AuthenticationResultCode
member.summary: A status code that offers additional information about authentication success or failure.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.StatusDescription
member.summary: A description of the HTTP status code.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.RestResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP Status code for the request.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ResourceSet.Resources
member.summary: A collection of one or more resources. The resources that are returned depend on the request. Information about resources is provided in the API reference for each Bing Maps REST Services API.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ResourceSet.EstimatedTotal
member.summary: An estimate of the total number of resources in the ResourceSet.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LocationResource.Confidence
member.summary: The confidence in the match.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LocationResource.Address
member.summary: The postal address for the location. An address can contain AddressLine, AdminDistrict, AdminDistrict2, CountryRegion, FormattedAddress, Locality, and PostalCode fields.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LocationResource.EntityType
member.summary: The classification of the geographic entity returned, such as Address.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LocationResource.Bbox
member.summary: A geographic area that contains the location. A bounding box contains SouthLatitude, WestLongitude, NorthLatitude, and EastLongitude values in units of degrees.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LocationResource.Point
member.summary: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the location.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LocationResource.Name
member.summary: The name of the resource.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Maps.RegisterModule(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a module with the map control. The name of the module is specified in moduleKey, the module script is defined in scriptUrl, and the options provides the location of a *.css file to load with the module.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Maps.RegisterModule(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a module with the map control. The name of the module is specified in moduleKey, the module script is defined in scriptUrl.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Maps.ModuleLoaded(System.String)
member.summary: Signals that the specified module has been loaded and if specified, calls the callback function in loadModule. Call this method at the end of your module script.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Maps.LoadModule(System.String,WebSharper.Bing.Maps.LoadModuleArgs)
member.summary: Loads the specified registered module, making its functionality available. A function is specified that is called when the module is loaded.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Maps.LoadModule(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified registered module, making its functionality available.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TileSource.ToString
member.summary: Converts the Color object to a string.

member.summary: Returns the pixel width of each tile in the tile source.

member.summary: Returns a string that constructs tile URLs used to retrieve tiles for the tile layer.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TileSource.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the pixel height of each tile in the tile source.

member.summary: Sets options for the tile layer.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TileLayer.GetZIndex
member.summary: Returns the z-index of the tile layer with respect to other items on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TileLayer.GetTileSource(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the tile source of the tile layer. The projection parameter accepts the following values: mercator, enhancedBirdseyeNorthUp, enhancedBirdseyeSouthUp, enhancedBirdseyeEastUp, enhancedBirdseyeWestUp

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TileLayer.GetOpacity
member.summary: Returns the opacity of the tile layer, defined as a double between 0 (not visible) and 1.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.TileLayer.A
member.summary: The opacity of the color. The range of valid values is 0 to 255.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Range.Max
member.summary: The maximum value in the range.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Range.Min
member.summary: The minimum value in the range.

member.summary: Converts the Pushpin object to a string.

member.summary: Sets options for the pushpin.

member.summary: Sets the location of the pushpin.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetZIndex
member.summary: Returns the z-index of the pushpin with respect to other items on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetWidth
member.summary: Returns the width of the pushpin, which is the width of the pushpin icon.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetVisible
member.summary: Returns whether the pushpin is visible. A value of false indicates that the pushpin is hidden, although it is still an entity on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetTypeName
member.summary: Returns the type of the pushpin.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetTextOffset
member.summary: Returns the amount the text is shifted from the pushpin icon.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetText
member.summary: Returns the text associated with the pushpin.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetLocation
member.summary: Returns the location of the pushpin.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the height of the pushpin, which is the height of the pushpin icon.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetIcon
member.summary: Returns the pushpin icon.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Pushpin.GetAnchor
member.summary: Returns the point on the pushpin icon which is anchored to the pushpin location. An anchor of (0,0) is the top left corner of the icon.

member.summary: The x value of the coordinate.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.GetY
member.summary: Returns the y-value of the pixel coordinate, relative to the map, of the mouse.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.GetX
member.summary: Returns the x-value of the pixel coordinate, relative to the map, of the mouse.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.Y
member.summary: Returns the y-value of the pixel coordinate, relative to the map, of the mouse.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.X
member.summary: Returns the x-value of the pixel coordinate, relative to the map, of the mouse.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.WheelData
member.summary: The number of units that the mouse wheel has changed.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.TargetType
member.summary: The type of the object that fired the event. Valid values include the following: 'map', 'polygon', 'polyline', or 'pushpin'

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.Target
member.summary: The object that fired the event.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.PageY
member.summary: The y-value of the pixel coordinate on the page of the mouse cursor.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.PageX
member.summary: The x-value of the pixel coordinate on the page of the mouse cursor.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.OriginalEvent
member.summary: The original browser event.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.IsTouchEvent
member.summary: A boolean indicating whether the event that occurred was a touch event.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.IsSecondary
member.summary: A boolean indicating if the secondary mouse button (such as the right mouse button) was used.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.IsPrimary
member.summary: A boolean indicating if the primary button (such as the left mouse button or a tap on a touch screen) was used.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: A boolean indicating whether the event is handled. If this property is set to true, the default map control behavior for the event is cancelled.

member.name: P:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MouseEventArgs.EventName
member.summary: The event that occurred.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryPixelToLocation(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Point[])
member.summary: Converts an array of Points relative to PixelReference.Viewport and returns an array of Locations if all points were converted. If any of the conversions fail, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryPixelToLocation(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Point[],WebSharper.Bing.Maps.PixelReference)
member.summary: Converts an array of Points relative to the specified PixelReference and returns an array of Locations if all points were converted. If any of the conversions fail, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryPixelToLocation(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Point)
member.summary: Converts a specified Point to a Location on the map relative to PixelReference.Viewport. If the map is not able to convert the Point, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryPixelToLocation(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Point,WebSharper.Bing.Maps.PixelReference)
member.summary: Converts a specified Point to a Location on the map relative to the specified PixelReference. If the map is not able to convert the Point, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryLocationToPixel(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Location[])
member.summary: Converts an array of Locations relative to PixelReference.Viewport and returns an array of Points if all locations were converted. If any of the conversions fail, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryLocationToPixel(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Location[],WebSharper.Bing.Maps.PixelReference)
member.summary: Converts an array of Locations relative to the specified PixelReference and returns an array of Points if all locations were converted. If any of the conversions fail, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryLocationToPixel(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Location)
member.summary: Converts a specified Location to a Point on the map relative to PixelReference.Viewport. If the map is not able to convert the Location, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.TryLocationToPixel(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Location,WebSharper.Bing.Maps.PixelReference)
member.summary: Converts a specified Location to a Point on the map relative to the specified PixelReference. If the map is not able to convert the Location, null is returned.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.SetView(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.ViewOptions)
member.summary: Sets the map view based on the specified options.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.SetOptions(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Size)
member.summary: Sets the height and width of the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.SetMapType(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.MapTypeId)
member.summary: Sets the current map type. The specified mapTypeId must be a valid map type ID or a registered map type ID.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.IsRotationEnabled
member.summary: Returns true if the current map type allows the heading to change; false if the display heading is fixed.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.IsMercator
member.summary: Returns whether the map is in a regular Mercator nadir mode.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetZoomRange
member.summary: Returns the range of valid zoom levels for the current map view.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetZoom
member.summary: Returns the zoom level of the current map view.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetWidth
member.summary: Returns the width of the map control.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetViewportY
member.summary: Returns the y coordinate of the viewport origin (the center of the map), relative to the page.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetViewportX
member.summary: Returns the x coordinate of the viewport origin (the center of the map), relative to the page.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetUserLayer
member.summary: Returns the map’s user node.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetTargetZoom
member.summary: Returns the zoom level of the view to which the map is navigating.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetTargetMetersPerPixel
member.summary: Returns the scale in meters per pixel of the center of the view to which the map is navigating.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetTargetHeading
member.summary: Returns the heading of the view to which the map is navigating.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetTargetCenter
member.summary: Returns the center location of the view to which the map is navigating.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetTargetBounds
member.summary: Returns the location rectangle that defines the boundaries of the view to which the map is navigating.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetRootElement
member.summary: Returns the map’s root node.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetPageY
member.summary: Returns the y coordinate of the top left corner of the map control, relative to the page.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetPageX
member.summary: Returns the x coordinate of the top left corner of the map control, relative to the page.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetOptions
member.summary: Returns the map options that have been set. Note that if an option is not set, then the default value for that option is assumed and getOptions returns undefined for that option.

member.summary: Returns the map’s mode node.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetMetersPerPixel
member.summary: Returns the current scale in meters per pixel of the center of the map.

member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current map type displayed on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetImageryId
member.summary: Returns the string that represents the imagery currently displayed on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the height of the map control.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetHeading
member.summary: Returns the heading of the current map view.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Map.GetCredentials(System.Action{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String}})
member.summary: Gets the session ID. This method calls the callback function with the session ID as the first parameter.

member.summary: Gets the array of strings representing the attributions of the imagery currently displayed on the map.

member.summary: Deletes the Map object and releases any associated resources.

member.summary: The map’s entities. Use this property to add or remove entities from the map.

member.summary: The event that occurred.

member.summary: Sets options for the infobox.

member.summary: Sets the location on the map where the anchor of the infobox is attached.

member.summary: Sets the HTML content of the infobox. You can use this method to change the look of the infobox.

member.summary: Returns the z-index of the infobox with respect to other items on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetWidth
member.summary: Returns the width of the infobox.

member.summary: Returns whether the infobox is visible. A value of false indicates that the infobox is hidden, although it is still an entity on the map.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetTitleClickHandler
member.summary: Returns the name of the function to call when the title of the infobox is clicked.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetTitle
member.summary: Returns a string that is the title of the infobox.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetShowPointer
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether the infobox is drawn with a pointer.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetShowCloseButton
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether the infobox close button is shown.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetOptions
member.summary: Returns the infobox options.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetOffset
member.summary: Returns the amount the infobox pointer is shifted from the location of the infobox, or if showPointer is false, then it is the amount the infobox bottom left edge is shifted from the location of the infobox. The default value is (0,0), which means there is no offset.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetLocation
member.summary: Returns the location on the map where the infobox’s anchor is attached.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetId
member.summary: Returns the ID of the infobox.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetHtmlContent
member.summary: Returns the infobox as HTML.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the height of the infobox.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetDescription
member.summary: Returns the string that is printed inside the infobox.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetAnchor
member.summary: Returns the point on the infobox which is anchored to the map. An anchor of (0,0) is the top left corner of the infobox.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Infobox.GetActions
member.summary: Returns a list of actions, where each item is a name-value pair indicating an action link name and the event name for the action that corresponds to that action link.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.GeoLocationProvider.RemoveAccuracyCircle
member.summary: Removes the current geo location accuracy circle.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.GeoLocationProvider.GetCurrentPosition(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.PositionOptions)
member.summary: Obtains the user’s current location and displays it on the map. Important: The accuracy of the user location obtained using this method varies widely depending on the desktop browser or mobile device of the requesting client. Desktop users may experience low user location accuracy (accuracy circles with large radiuses), while mobile user location accuracy may be much greater (a few meters).

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.GeoLocationProvider.CancelRequest
member.summary: Cancels the processing of the current getCurrentPosition request. This method prevents the response from being processed.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.GeoLocationProvider.AddAccuracyCircle(WebSharper.Bing.Maps.Location,System.Double,System.Int32,WebSharper.Bing.Maps.PositionCircleOptions)
member.summary: Renders a geo location accuracy circle on the map. The accuracy circle is created with the center at the specified location, using the given radiusInMeters, and with the specified number of segments for the accuracy circle polygon. Additional options are also available to adjust the style of the polygon.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.EntityCollection.ToString
member.summary: Converts the EntityCollection object to a string.

member.summary: Removes the last entity from the collection and returns it.

member.summary: Returns the index of the specified entity in the collection. If the entity is not found in the collection, -1 is returned.

member.summary: Gets the z-index of the entity collection with respect to other items on the map.

member.summary: Returns whether the entity collection is visible on the map.

member.summary: Returns the number of entities in the collection.

member.summary: Returns the entity at the specified index in the collection.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Bing.Maps.EntityCollection.Clear

member.summary: Converts the Color object to a string.

member.summary: Attaches the handler for the event that is thrown by the target, where the minimum interval between events (in milliseconds) is specified in the ThrottleInterval parameter. The last occurrence of the event is called after the specified ThrottleInterval.
